intro: Diplotropis brachypetala, commonly known as the short-petaled diplotropis, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Diplotropis brachypetala is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
